message.content:
{"id": "2345", "title": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "description": "Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", "OB": "When a file is already open in the editor and the user tries to open the same file with a different type of editor using the 'Open With...' menu option, nothing happens.", "EB": "When a file is already open in the editor and the user tries to open the same file with a different type of editor using the 'Open With...' menu option, a new editor instance should be opened for the file with the selected editor type.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open a new basic project
2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'
3. With the 'test.xml' file selected in the Navigator, choose 'Open With...'
4. Select 'Default Text Editor' from the options
5. Verify that no new editor instance is opened for the file

EXPECTED BEHAVIOR:
A new editor instance should be opened for the file with the selected editor type."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: "}
